intro: Isolepis consanguinea, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, thread-like leaves. Its flowering spikes are typically arranged in dense clusters, producing small, inconspicuous flowers. Isolepis consanguinea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
